intro: Albuca lebaensis, commonly known as the Lëbaensis onion, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Amaryllidaceae family and is characterized by its strap-like, grass-like foliage. The plant produces clusters of white or pale purple flowers that bloom in summer. It is often grown as an ornamental plant due to its attractive appearance and ease of cultivation. Albuca lebaensis prefers well-drained soil and full sun to partial shade.
